page.title: 04A YEAR IN CRAWLEY DOWN
page.content: In Crawley Down there are many annual events.{Jumble sales}are popular in the winter. Old clothes and household articles are sold. The{Junior School's {May Day}takes place towards the end of May. Many people go and enjoy the songs, dancing and acting, and watch the{May Queen}being crowned. In early June, teams of villagers take part in the{Stoolball Tournament}at the Haven Sports Field. There are swing boats and a bouncy castle to entertain the children. The season for{fetes}is June and July. There are many stalls and they raise a lot of money.{Schools' {sports days}are next and lots of children run in races. The big event of the year is the{Village Fayre}in early September. There are always lots of people who come to talk, play and buy. It is good fun. Finally,{carol {singers}tour the village at{Christmas.
